extendedIngredients.name: pineapple juice
extendedIngredients.original: 1 (8-ounce) can pineapple tidbits in juice, undrained

extendedIngredients.name: red delicious apple
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 cups chopped Red Delicious apple (about 2 medium)

title: Cabbage-Pineapple Slaw
summary: Cabbage-Pineapple Slaw might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe makes 5 servings with 104 calories, 1g of protein, and 3g of fat each. For 45 cents per serving, this recipe covers 6% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. If you have pineapple tidbits in juice, celery, mayonnaise, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and vegetarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 29%. This score is not so awesome. Try Old El PasoÂ® Grilled Chicken and Pineapple Tacos with Cabbage and Mango Slaw, Cabbage Slaw, and Red-Cabbage Slaw for similar recipes.
instructions: Drain pineapple, reserving 3 tablespoons juice. Combine drained pineapple, shredded cabbage, and next 3 ingredients in a large bowl.                                                                                                Combine reserved pineapple juice and mayonnaise; add to cabbage mixture, tossing gently. Cover and chill.                                                                                                To serve, spoon mixture into a cabbage leaf-lined bowl, and garnish with apple slices, if desired (cabbage leaves and apple slices not included in analysis).                                                                                                Tip: This tasty chilled salad is a cross between Waldorf salad and coleslaw.

steps.step: Combine drained pineapple, shredded cabbage, and next 3 ingredients in a large bowl.
Combine reserved pineapple juice and mayonnaise; add to cabbage mixture, tossing gently. Cover and chill.
To serve, spoon mixture into a cabbage leaf-lined bowl, and garnish with apple slices, if desired (cabbage leaves and apple slices not included in analysis).
Tip: This tasty chilled salad is a cross between Waldorf salad and coleslaw.
